meanings.definition: To agree to a demand, request, or treaty.
meanings.sent1: The country decided to accede to the peace treaty.
meanings.sent2: She finally acceded to his request to help him with his homework.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn cat had to accede to the dog's demand for the best spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: After much debate, the board of directors had no choice but to accede to the shareholders' demands.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's strict rules left no room for the students to accede to their own desires.

meanings.definition: To assume an office or position.
meanings.sent1: He will accede to the role of class president next semester.
meanings.sent2: The new CEO will accede to his position at the company next week.
meanings.sent3: The young prince was excited to accede to the throne and become king.
meanings.sent4: The experienced lawyer was ready to accede to the position of judge in the court.
meanings.sent5: The dedicated nurse was honored to accede to the role of head nurse in the hospital.
